Summary: small binking light, orange and green in colour travelling in a straight line in a WNW direction
trends: There has been one other sighting in Courtice
There were no other sightings in Courtice on or around September 19th 2010
divs: sighting detailsi was star gazing with my sister, looking at planets, the moon etc. then my sister asked me what a spot of light was in the sky. i saw what she was looking at and it was a strange blinking light, orange and green alternating, visible colouring to the naked eye. the object was moving in a west-northwest direction. the rate of speed that it was travelling at made me think that it was a plane of some kind. i aimed my telescope (specs: 8" f\6 dobsonian skywatcher, 10mm plossl lens) at the object. while i was expecting to see a plane, which i have seen through my scope, what i saw was more like the star betelgeuse, except that it was travelling through my scope faster than any planets that i have observed. it lasted until i lost it after 26 mins of observation, after which i lost it behind some houses. apparent altitude was less than 1000 feet. no sound was heard nor any electronic or magnetic interference.
